meanings.definition: To make something abstract more concrete or real.
meanings.sent1: The artist reifies his emotions into beautiful paintings.
meanings.sent2: She reifies her dreams by turning them into achievable goals.
meanings.sent3: The magician reifies his thoughts into tangible illusions.
meanings.sent4: The writer reifies her imagination into captivating stories.
meanings.sent5: The scientist reifies abstract theories into practical experiments.

meanings.definition: To treat something abstract as if it were a concrete object.
meanings.sent1: The child reifies his stuffed animals as real companions.
meanings.sent2: He reifies his fears by giving them physical forms in his mind.
meanings.sent3: The student reifies history lessons as exciting adventures.
meanings.sent4: The chef reifies flavors into colorful personalities on the plate.
meanings.sent5: The teacher reifies abstract concepts into hands-on activities for her students.
